item.description:
Want to be a Ghostbuster? Well here's your chance! Join us on Sat. Oct 27th for a quick intro and play through of a locally written scenario. All you need is some imagination and a handful of six sided dice. (If you don't have any dice some will be provided, however if you don't have imagination we can't help with that!)
Here's the teaser:

GHOSTBUSTERS: The Los Angeles Incident
Who ya gonna call?
Location: Los Angeles, California
The Year: 1985

The Ghostbusters, after riding the sudden popularity of success having defended New York City against an otherworldly, supernatural threat are embarking on the opening of their very first franchise. Recent leads, detected by Dr. Egon Spengler suggest that the city of Los Angeles, California has been experiencing a phenomenon unexplainable by conventional science. Earthquakes and Tremors are increasing in the downtown area and seem to be intensifying. However, it hasn't been released to the public or the press that the LAPD is receiving reports that a mysterious figure is often witnessed in the area just before these quakes take place. Spook sightings are also on the rise and not knowing who else to turn to, someone in the Mayor’s camp reached out and tipped off the Ghostbusters. Rumors have also begun swirling about the Mayor's nocturnal activities...
And as we begin, at a press conference being held by the city's Mayor introducing the newly formed team of Ghostbusters to the city of Los Angeles, this new chapter will begin to realize that they have their work cut out for them as everyone seems to be hiding, something. But what?

Come bust some ghost with us!
Who knows we may even have a real proton pack and some other goodies for you to check out too!
Open to everyone. Free of charge.
5 spots available.
Questions or want to reserve your spot? Email wayne@sagesofrpg.com

Brought to you by:
item.how_to_find_us: We will be the people playing the RPG in the main room.

group.name: The Portsmouth, NH / Seacoast Boardgames Group

item.name: Ghostbusters RPG at Port City Makerspace
